Description: About half of pottery bowl; flaring ring foot and echinoid rim. Fine creamy buff clay. Graffito under foot.
Curator's comments: Probably a small and fairly early Corinthian echinus bowl, although such pieces are normally glazed, at least in part, and there is no sure sign of paint on this piece.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 470)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.227)
